name: Accumulation Points of a Sequence - Mathonlinemathonline.wikidot.com › accumulation-points-of-a-sequence
description: Definition: Let be a sequence of real numbers. The number is said to be an accumulation point of if there exists a subsequence such that $\lim_{k \to \infty} a_{n_k} = a$, that is, $\forall \epsilon > 0$ $\exists K \in \mathbb{N}$ such that if then $\mid a_{n_k} - a \mid < \epsilon$.
